issues.description: The template's singFarmSongVerse method signature has no Animal parameter, but the UML in the problem statement specifies singFarmSongVerse(animal: Animal) and the reference solution implements private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal). Students following the template cannot compile or call the verse method correctly.
issues.suggested_fix: Uncomment and include the Animal parameter in the template method signature: change private void singFarmSongVerse(/*Animal animal*/) to private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal).

issues.description: The reference solution defines Rideable.messageOnRide(int speed) with a speed parameter, but the problem statement's UML and the template Main.java expect a no-argument messageOnRide(): String. This signature mismatch will prevent students from matching the intended interface and using the provided Main code.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the Rideable interface and its implementations with the problem statement by removing the speed parameter: use String messageOnRide() in the interface and implementing classes.

issues.description: The problem specification defines the interface Rideable with a no-argument method messageOnRide():String, but the solution repository defines Rideable.messageOnRide(int speed) (and Pig/Seal implementations require an int parameter), causing a signature mismatch and preventing students from mapping the required method to the solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution’s Rideable interface and its implementations with the problem spec by changing messageOnRide(int speed) back to messageOnRide() with no parameters, and update Pig and Seal to return "Riding on [Animal Type] [name]" as described.
